ssml: <speak xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/synthesis" xmlns:mstts="http://www.w3.org/2001/mstts" version="1.0" xml:lang="en-US"><voice name="en-US-AndrewNeural"><mstts:silence type="Leading-exact" value="0"/><prosody pitch="+0.00%" rate="+0.00%" volume="-10.00%"><break time="1320ms"/></prosody><prosody pitch="+1.54%" rate="-0.55%" volume="-10.00%">The stale smell of old beer lingers.</prosody><prosody pitch="+2.79%" rate="-0.44%" volume="-10.00%"><break time="700ms"/></prosody><prosody pitch="+3.79%" rate="-0.71%" volume="-10.00%">It takes heat to bring out the odor.</prosody><prosody pitch="+3.03%" rate="-0.57%" volume="-10.00%"><break time="760ms"/></prosody><prosody pitch="+1.40%" rate="-0.92%" volume="-10.00%">A cold dip restores health and zest.</prosody><prosody pitch="+1.12%" rate="-0.74%" volume="-10.00%"><break time="580ms"/></prosody><prosody pitch="-0.13%" rate="-1.03%" volume="-10.00%">A salt pickle tastes fine with ham.</prosody><prosody pitch="-0.10%" rate="-0.82%" volume="-10.00%"><break time="560ms"/></prosody><prosody pitch="+1.48%" rate="-2.46%" volume="-10.00%">Tacos al pastor are my favorite.</prosody><prosody pitch="+2.74%" rate="-1.97%" volume="-10.00%"><break time="740ms"/></prosody><prosody pitch="+1.17%" rate="-3.58%" volume="-10.00%">A zestful food is the hot cross bun.</prosody><prosody pitch="+0.94%" rate="-2.86%" volume="-10.00%"><break time="500ms"/></prosody><mstts:silence type="Tailing-exact" value="0"/></voice></speak>
